results.title: Optimal control of myocardial ischaemia: the benefit of a fixed combination of atenolol and nifedipine in patients with chronic stable angina.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: To study the effects on @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial ischaemia@@@ of 50 mg of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, 20 mg of slow release @CHEMICAL_Nifedipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009543 @@@nifedipine@@@, and their fixed combination given 12 hourly.

citations.NLM: el-Tamimi H, Davies GJ. Optimal control of myocardial ischaemia: the benefit of a fixed combination of atenolol and nifedipine in patients with chronic stable angina. Br Heart J. 1992 Sep;68(3):291-5. PMID: 1389761

results.title: [Effect of atenolol, dibunol, peroxidase and Astragalus dasynthus on the morphometric parameters of myocardial infarction].
results.text_hl: In the @DISEASE_Myocardial_Infarction @DISEASE_MESH:D009203 @@@myocardial infarction@@@ region there is the border zone or reversibly damaged zone which may be partially saved from @DISEASE_Necrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@necrosis@@@ by using beta-blocking agents. @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Butylated_Hydroxytoluene @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002084 @@@dibunol@@@, @SPECIES_1182584 @@@Astragalus dasyanthus pall@@@. moderately decrease the @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial damage@@@ area at permanent and transient @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@.

results.title: Improved cardiac outcomes with combined atenolol and diazepam intervention in seizure.
results.text_hl: This study demonstrates that @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ intervention should be strongly considered as an adjunct clinical treatment to reduce @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@cardiomyopathy@@@ during @DISEASE_Seizures @DISEASE_MESH:D012640 @@@seizures@@@.

citations.NLM: Read MI, Millen RN, McCann DM, Harrison JC, Kerr DS, Sammut IA. Improved cardiac outcomes with combined atenolol and diazepam intervention in seizure. Epilepsia. 2018 Apr;59(4):854-865. PMID: 29512824

results.title: Effects of atenolol and diltiazem on exercise tolerance and ambulatory ischaemia.
results.text_hl: Thus, while comparable effects were achieved on clinical variables, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ appeared to be more effective than @CHEMICAL_Diltiazem @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004110 @@@diltiazem@@@, reducing @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial ischaemia@@@ during exercise and ambulatory monitoring.

citations.NLM: Steffensen R, Grande P, Pedersen F, Haunsø S. Effects of atenolol and diltiazem on exercise tolerance and ambulatory ischaemia. Int J Cardiol. 1993 Jul 1;40(2):143-53. PMID: 8349377

results.title: The prevention of myocardial ultrastructural changes by perindopril, atenolol and amlodipine in chronic alcohol administered rats.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Perindopril @CHEMICAL_MESH:D020913 @@@Perindopril@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ but not @CHEMICAL_Amlodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017311 @@@amlodipine@@@ produced some significant beneficial effects on @CHEMICAL_Alcohols @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000438 @@@alcohol@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial damages@@@.

results.title: Intrinsic sympathomimetic activity and coronary blood flow.
results.text_hl: 1 The effects of four beta-adrenoceptor blocking agents, @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Pindolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010869 @@@pindolol@@@, @CHEMICAL_Practolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011217 @@@practolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@, used in doses inducing the same degree of beta 1-adrenoceptor blockade, have been investigated on regional @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial@@@ blood flow (microspheres) and coronary vascular resistance in the normal and @DISEASE_Myocardial_Stunning @DISEASE_MESH:D017682 @@@ischaemic myocardium@@@ of the anaesthetized @SPECIES_9615 @@@dog@@@. 2 In the @DISEASE_Optic_Neuropathy_Ischemic @DISEASE_MESH:D018917 @@@ischaemic@@@ and non-@DISEASE_Optic_Neuropathy_Ischemic @DISEASE_MESH:D018917 @@@ischaemic@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial@@@ areas, transmural blood flow was significantly reduced by @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ which are devoid of intrinsic sympathomimetic activity (ISA) while it remained unaffected by beta-adrenoceptor blocking drugs endowed with ISA, whether cardioselective (@CHEMICAL_Practolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011217 @@@practolol@@@) or not (@CHEMICAL_Pindolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D010869 @@@pindolol@@@).

citations.NLM: Berdeaux A, Giudicelli JF. Intrinsic sympathomimetic activity and coronary blood flow. Br J Clin Pharmacol. 1982;13(Suppl 2):175S-180S. PMID: 6125167
citations.BibTeX: @article{6125167, title={Intrinsic sympathomimetic activity and coronary blood flow.}, author={Berdeaux A and Giudicelli JF}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={13}, number={Suppl 2}, pages={175S-180S}}

results.title: Effect of atenolol pre-treatment in heart damage in a model of intestinal ischemia-reperfusion.
results.text_hl: PURPOSE: To investigate the effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in @DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ mediator and oxidative stress in a @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial injury@@@ by intestinal @DISEASE_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D007511 @@@ischemia@@@/reperfusion in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rat@@@ model.

results.title: Medical treatment of patients with severe exertional and rest angina: double blind comparison of beta blocker, calcium antagonist, and nitrate.
results.text_hl: Thus beta receptor blockade with @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ was the most effective means of reducing @<m>DISEASE_Cardiomyopathies</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009202 @@@myocardial ischaemia@@@ both during exercise and at rest at night without causing deterioration in any @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@.
